title: EN IMAGES. TempÃªte solaire : des aurores borÃ©ales visibles un peu partout en France cette nuit, dÃ©couvrez ce spectacle impressionnant
text:
EN IMAGES. TempÃªte solaire : des aurores borÃ©ales visibles un peu partout en France cette nuit, dÃ©couvrez ce spectacle impressionnant
Le ciel a pris une teinte colorÃ©e pendant la nuit dans diffÃ©rents coins de lâ€™Hexagone en raison dâ€™une nouvelle tempÃªte solaire.
Des images toujours sublimes. Dans la nuit de jeudi Ã  vendredi, des aurores borÃ©ales ont pu Ãªtre observÃ©es un peu partout en France en raison dâ€™une nouvelle tempÃªte solaire. De Lyon Ã  la Normandie en passant par Troyes et les Alpes-Maritimes, plusieurs internautes ont partagÃ© des photos spectaculaires sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux.
Jâ€™ai bougÃ© pour dÃ©placer ma voiture et je viens de voir quoi ?

Une Ã©ruption solaire sâ€™accompagne dâ€™Ã©jection de masse coronale ou CME. Câ€™est cette masse coronale qui est Ã  lâ€™origine de lâ€™apparition des aurores borÃ©ales dans le ciel quand elle atteint notre champ magnÃ©tique.
Pourquoi voit-on frÃ©quemment des aurores borÃ©ales ces derniers temps ?
Le Soleil traverse actuellement un pic dâ€™activitÃ©, Câ€™est pourquoi les aurores borÃ©ales sont particuliÃ¨rement frÃ©quentes ces derniers mois.
Le phÃ©nomÃ¨ne a pu Ãªtre observÃ© ailleurs dans le monde. Aux Ã‰tats-Unis, en Russie, en Angleterre ou Canada, des aurores borÃ©ales sont apparus dans le ciel.

author: Mailhy Rojas
title: Gobierno de Donald Trump anunciÃ³ despido masivo de 10.000 empleados del Departamento de Salud de Estados Unidos | Robert F. Kennedy Jr. | hnews | Mundo | La RepÃºblica
text:
Gobierno de Trump anunciÃ³ despido masivo de 10.000 empleados del Departamento de Salud de Estados Unidos
Robert F. Kennedy Jr., secretario de Salud de Estados Unidos, comunicÃ³ la reducciÃ³n de 10.000 empleos, como parte de la estrategia de reducciÃ³n del aparato estatal promovida por el gobierno del presidente Donald Trump.
El secretario de Salud de Estados Unidos, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., informÃ³ el jueves 27 de marzo sobre un nuevo plan que contempla la reducciÃ³n de 10.000 puestos de trabajo en su departamento. Esta decisiÃ³n se enmarca en la polÃ­tica del presidente Donald Trump de reducir el aparato estatal. A esta cifra se suman los empleos que no fueron renovados por jubilaciones anticipadas y aquellos que se extinguieron mediante despidos voluntarios con compensaciÃ³n econÃ³mica, promovidos por el Departamento de Eficiencia Gubernamental (DOGE), entidad liderada por Elon Musk, actual mano derecha del mandatario.
Con esta medida, la plantilla del Departamento de Salud pasarÃ¡ de contar con 82.000 trabajadores a tener 62.000. Este recorte representa un esfuerzo por redimensionar la estructura gubernamental, buscando mayor eficiencia y control del gasto pÃºblico, en concordancia con los lineamientos de gestiÃ³n impulsados por la Casa Blanca.
VIDEO MÃS VISTO
Â¡Escape en el Ãºltimo segundo! Dos personas logran huir de un auto atascado justo antes de que un tren lo impacte.
PUEDES VER:
[DecisiÃ³n judicial ordena al gobierno de Trump reincorporar "inmediatamente" a empleados en periodo de prueba despedidos]
Departamento de Salud de EE. UU. anuncia despidos masivos a 10.000 empleados
El Departamento de Salud de EE. UU. notificÃ³ formalmente a los lÃ­deres sindicales de la FederaciÃ³n Estadounidense de Empleados PÃºblicos sobre una inminente reducciÃ³n de personal. De acuerdo con un correo electrÃ³nico enviado por Thomas J. Nagy Jr., subsecretario adjunto de recursos humanos del HHS, al que accediÃ³ CNN, entre 8.000 y 10.000 trabajadores serÃ­an afectados por los despidos, cuya ejecuciÃ³n estÃ¡ prevista para el 27 de mayo. Las notificaciones individuales podrÃ­an comenzar a enviarse desde el viernes 28 de marzo.
Las Ã¡reas mÃ¡s afectadas por los recortes serÃ¡n los puestos administrativos, como recursos humanos, tecnologÃ­as de la informaciÃ³n, adquisiciones y finanzas. AdemÃ¡s, las medidas apuntan a funciones ubicadas en regiones de alto costo y a cargos considerados redundantes o duplicados dentro del HHS o en otras agencias federales.
Kennedy Jr. propone recorte en salud pese a crÃ­ticas por postura antivacunas
Algunas posturas de Kennedy Jr. generaron inquietudes entre expertos en salud pÃºblica, especialmente por su escepticismo respecto a la vacunaciÃ³n contra enfermedades como el sarampiÃ³n y por sugerir que se deberÃ­a permitir la propagaciÃ³n sin control de la gripe aviar entre las aves de corral en EE. UU.
SegÃºn informaciÃ³n oficial, sus propuestas permitirÃ­an un ahorro de aproximadamente US$1.800 millones anuales, cifra que representa solo el 0,1% del presupuesto total del Departamento de Salud y Servicios Humanos, el cual asciende a US$1,8 billones, es decir, alrededor de una cuarta parte del gasto federal total. "No solo estamos reduciendo la expansiÃ³n burocrÃ¡tica", dijo Kennedy Jr. en el comunicado. "Estamos reajustando la organizaciÃ³n a su misiÃ³n principal y a nuestras nuevas prioridades para revertir la epidemia de enfermedades crÃ³nicas", agregÃ³.
PUEDES VER:
[Donald Trump anunciÃ³ aranceles del 25% a todos los coches no fabricados en Estados Unidos a partir del 2 de abril]
Recortes en la FDA y CDC afectarÃ¡n a miles de empleados
SegÃºn documentos internos obtenidos por The Wall Street Journal, el plan contempla el despido de 3.500 trabajadores de la AdministraciÃ³n de Alimentos y Medicamentos (FDA), lo que equivale al 19% del personal total de dicha entidad. Asimismo, se prevÃ© la salida de 2.400 empleados de los Centros para el Control y la PrevenciÃ³n de Enfermedades (CDC), lo que representa el 18% de su plantilla.
AdemÃ¡s de los recortes de personal, las reformas incluyen una reestructuraciÃ³n en la red de oficinas regionales, que pasarÃ¡ de contar con 10 sedes a solo 5, en un esfuerzo por reducir el tamaÃ±o de la burocracia y concentrar funciones clave.

author: AFP
title: Japan hammer China, Australia stunned in World Cup qualifiers - Breitbart
text: Japan made a rampant start to the decisive third round of Asian qualifying for the 2026 World Cup by hammering China 7-0 on Thursday but Australia suffered a shock home defeat by Bahrain. In other action, Palestine earned a deserved point with a 0-0 draw away at South Korea as they attempt to reach the World Cup for the first time. Premier League stars Kaoru Mitoma and Wataru Endo both scored as Japan taught a hapless China a lesson in Saitama. Brighton winger Mitoma, who has missed a chunk of this year with injury, was making his first appearance for Japan since the Asian Cup in January. He announced his return in emphatic style in front of more than 50,000 fans, scoring with a first-half header after Liverpoolâ€™s Endo had given Japan the lead. â€œThe home support was overwhelming and that allowed us to play well from the first whistle,â€ Mitoma said. Takumi Minamino added two more goals after the break to put Japan on cruise control against a China side looking to qualify for their first World Cup since 2002. It was a night to forget for China, who squeezed into the third qualifying round thanks only to a superior head-to-head record over Thailand. Also in Group C, Bahrain stunned Australia 1-0 on the Gold Coast thanks to an 89th-minute Harry Souttar own goal. With the hosts down to 10 men, the match was headed for a scoreless draw until the defender deflected a shot into his own net. The Socceroos struggled for fluency against their defensively minded opponents and their hopes nosedived after a red card in the 77th minute to striker Kusini Yengi for a high kick. â€œItâ€™s a learning curve for the players. It wasnâ€™t our night,â€ Australia coach Graham Arnold said. Roberto Manciniâ€™s Saudi Arabia were held to a surprise 1-1 draw in their Group C opener at home to Indonesia, a team ranked 77 spots below them. The visitors took the lead when Ragnar Oratmangoen deflected the ball past goalkeeper Mohammed Al-Owais in the 19th minute. Musab Al-Juwayrâ€™s own deflected strike in first-half stoppage time then levelled matters. Salem Al-Dawsari squandered a golden opportunity to put the Saudis ahead 12 minutes from time when his penalty was saved by Indonesia goalkeeper Maarten Paes. Uzbekistan edged North Korea 1-0 in Tashkent in the opening game in Group A. The top two from each of the three Asian groups will be guaranteed a place at the expanded 48-team World Cup in the United States, Canada and Mexico. The third qualifying round wraps up in June. Palestine earn point At the 66,000-capacity Seoul World Cup Stadium in Group B, Palestine gave South Korea a major scare in an entertaining goalless stalemate. Making their debut in the third stage of Asian qualifying and 96th in FIFAâ€™s rankings to South Koreaâ€™s 23rd, Palestine refused to be overawed for much of an open contest. Palestine play their home matches abroad, usually in the Middle East, because of the war in Gaza. The local league has been suspended and many of the players are without a club. Despite those obstacles, they were good value for the draw. Palestine thought they had taken the lead in the 22nd minute, only for the goal to be correctly ruled out for offside. Oday Dabbagh went close for the visitors on the break in the second half, before Spurs star Son Heung-min rattled the outside of the Palestine post in the dying minutes. The away side could have won it themselves late on but goalkeeper Jo Hyeon-woo saved South Korea from an embarrassing defeat. Palestine face Jordan on Tuesday in Kuala Lumpur in what is nominally a home match. Also in Group B, Iraq opened their account with a 1-0 victory at home against Oman in Basra. Asian Cup runners-up Jordan saw victory snatched from their grasp in injury-time as Kuwait earned a 1-1 draw at Amman International Stadium in the other game in the group. Meanwhile, Asian champions Qatar let slip a 1-0 lead at home to the UAE to lose 3-1 in Group A. Ibrahim Al-Hassan had put the hosts in front seven minutes before half-time at Al Rayyan Stadium, but Paulo Bentoâ€™s side rallied late in the second half through goals from Harib Abdalla, Khaled Al-Dhanhani and substitute Ali Saleh. In Group Aâ€™s other match, perennial World Cup qualifiers Iran defeated Kyrgyzstan 1-0 in Fuladshahr, with Inter Milan striker Mehdi Taremi getting the gameâ€™s only goal just after the half-hour.

author: Mike Mangas
title: Flu cases double in Northstate, experts urge vaccination
text:
REDDING, Calif. â€” A significant increase in flu cases has been reported in the Northstate this year, with Shasta Regional Medical Center seeing more than twice the number of positive tests compared to the same period last year.
"Last year we saw a 5.6% positivity rate for influenza infections; this year we are seeing 11.1%, which is double what we saw last year," said Dr. Morris Jones, laboratory director at Shasta Regional Medical Center.
Chief Nursing Officer Brian Bradley suggested that the increase might be partly due to people letting their guard down post-pandemic. "We are seeing double what we saw last year this time. In fact, our year-to-date last year versus today is double. So, with two months to go in the flu season, we will end up seeing many more flu cases this year than we did last year," Bradley said.
When asked about the reasons behind the surge, Bradley said they are not entirely sure but noted that people are more active post-COVID, emphasizing the need for precautions every flu season. He added that the severity of flu cases varies, with some being mild and others requiring hospitalization.
Dr. Jones advised that it is never too late to get a flu shot, as the flu is always present. The vaccine has about a 35% efficacy rate, which is average. He noted that the spike in cases is not surprising, as flu season runs from October 1 through April 30, leaving more than two months remaining in the season.

author: Mary Manley
title: California Coastline to Experience Monstrous Waves This Week
text: California Coast Put on Alert for 'Tremendous' Waves That Could Reach Up to 40 Feet The first huge swell of the winter has arrived in California, and with it comes dangerous surf set to rival some of the biggest waves this year.â€” San Francisco Chronicle (@sfchronicle) Read more: [https://t.co/BGPPPsd8Bz] ðŸŽ¥: [@stephenlamphoto] ðŸŽ¥ [pic.twitter.com/raSntIcDJ0] [December 28, 2023] [Nicole Sarment](https://www.sfchronicle.com/weather/article/california-surf-wave-warning-18575570.php), a weather service meteorologist. â€œPeople should really not even go.â€ A coastal Flood Warning is in effect for southern California until 3 pm! Beware of potential flooding, high tides, and strong winds along the coast due to large waves. Stay safe!â€” WeatherNation (@WeatherNation) [#CoastalFloodWarning] [#CAwx] [pic.twitter.com/gt1rbANJ5c] [December 28, 2023] At least three factors help to create these dramatic wave heights: wind speed, fetch, and time. Fetch being the area over the ocean where winds blow and generate waves, says the weather service. The longer the weather system sits there, the higher the waves will be. These type of weather systems are also more common during the winter months. High tides, big waves and rip currents are on tap for Southern Californiaâ€” Jon Baird (@KNXBaird) [#beaches]for the next couple of days. This is the view from the pier in [#HermosaBeach]. [@knxnews] [pic.twitter.com/cLgKuXdUZv] [December 28, 2023] â€œAs those (swells) come to the coast and they break, thatâ€™s when you get those large waves at the coastlines and at the beaches,â€ said [Alexis Clouser](https://www.washingtonpost.com/weather/2023/12/28/big-waves-california-storms-surf/), a weather service meteorologist. â€œThese are not the highest wave heights weâ€™ve seen, but theyâ€™re certainly on the larger side."

author: santiago-molina
title: Familiares y cercanos al asesinado candidato presidencial Fernando Villavicencio continuarÃ¡n con plantones para exigir justicia, celeridad y no impunidad en este crimen | PolÃ­tica | Noticias | El Universo
text: Exigir que no se permita la impunidad en el crimen del candidato presidencial Fernando Villavicencio y reclamar al sistema judicial, al Estado y a la FiscalÃ­a General celeridad en el procesamiento y las investigaciones para ubicar y condenar no solo a los autores materiales, sino, y principalmente, a los autores intelectuales del asesinato ocurrido el 9 de agosto de 2023, fueron los objetivos de un plantÃ³n que se realizÃ³, este jueves 27 de julio, en los exteriores del Complejo Judicial Norte, en Quito, y en el que estuvo Amanda Villavicencio, hija del peridista de 59 aÃ±os acribillado al estilo sicariato. â€œTodos queremos saber quiÃ©n ordenÃ³ asesinar a Fernando Villavicencio, mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de los gatilleros. Recordemos que de los 13 primeros, 7 fueron asesinados en la cÃ¡rcel y de eso no nos han dicho nada, ni a nosotras como familia, ni a la ciudadanÃ­a, ni a los medios de comunicaciÃ³n. (...) Nosotras hemos comenzado estos plantones de los jueves porque no tenÃ­amos respuestas, pero imagÃ­nense cÃ³mo es la presiÃ³n social y asÃ­ es como debe ser, (...), que en el primer plantÃ³n ya nos recibiÃ³ la fiscal Ana Hidalgo. Ese ha sido el primer contacto que hemos tenido directamente con la fiscal, (...), pero en esa reuniÃ³n nos comunicaron que sÃ­ existe otra investigaciÃ³n, la investigaciÃ³n de los autores intelectuales. Entonces ese es un primer alivio, entender que no es que solamente nos vamos a quedar con la sentencia de estas personas que les llamamos los gatilleros, estos cinco que quedan, sino que sÃ­ hay otra investigaciÃ³nâ€, refiriÃ³ Amanda Villavicencio. â€” Killa PedrÃ¡ (@agentedelcaos33) [#ATENCIÃ“N]InformaciÃ³n oficial sobre el incidente entre "El Invisible" y la hija de Fernando Villavicencio durante la audiencia de juzgamiento de los autores materiales del magnicidio. [pic.twitter.com/kCljugWEkE] [June 26, 2024] Entre la maÃ±ana del martes 26 de junio y la tarde del miÃ©rcoles 27 de junio Ãºltimos se han dado las dos primeras jornadas de audiencia de juzgamiento de cinco personas, a quienes se les acusa de haber participado, en diferentes niveles, en el asesinato del presidenciable de la alianza Gente Buena-Construye. Para la fiscal del caso, Ana Hidalgo, Carlos A., alias Invisible, participÃ³ en el asesinato en calidad de autor mediato; Laura C., alias la Flaca, como coautora y como cÃ³mplices Ã‰rick R., VÃ­ctor F. y Alexandra Ch. Publicidad Natalia Salazar, abogada de Amanda y Tamia Villavicencio, quienes actÃºan como acusacion particular en el proceso penal contra parte de los autores materiales del asesinato de su padre, sostiene la prueba testimonial de la FiscalÃ­a, tanto de peritos como de testigos presenciales, ha sido bastante fructÃ­fera hasta lo que va de la audiencia de juicio. Asegura que se ha arrojado nueva informaciÃ³n de la prÃ¡ctica, por ejemplo, del testimonio anticipado de un testigo protegido, al punto que han salido a la luz nuevos personajes, participaciÃ³n de otros individuos. [Segundo dÃ­a de audiencia en caso Fernando Villavicencio se centrÃ³ en el manejo dado al celular que pertenecerÃ­a al sicario que concretÃ³ el asesinato](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/politica/fernando-villavicencio-asesinato-acusacion-audiencia-de-juzgamiento-los-lobos-johann-castillo-sicario-elecciones-presidenciales-2023-fiscalia-de-pichincha-pericias-policia-nacional-corrupcion-narcotrafico-denuncias-nota/) â€œSi bien estas personas no se encuentran vinculadas a la presente causa, de fuentes oficiales, esto es, la FiscalÃ­a General del Estado, serÃ¡n oportunamente vinculados dentro de los procesos investigativos que tiene la ComisiÃ³n de la Verdad y Derechos Humanos de la FiscalÃ­a para determinar la individualidad de los autores intelectuales del asesinato de Fernando Villavicencio. Existe informaciÃ³n de relevancia en realidad, como por ejemplo, el precio que tuvo la vida del candidato presidencial en un valor de $ 200.000. Algo que es bastante reprochable en contra del Estado ecuatoriano y que esperamos que se corrija para no sistematizar la impunidad en el sistema judicial, es que los lÃ­deres de las bandas delictivas dan Ã³rdenes y configuran toda la logÃ­stica para la consumaciÃ³n de delitos desde las cÃ¡rceles ecuatorianas. En dÃ³nde estÃ¡ el control de las autoridades, en dÃ³nde estÃ¡ el control del SNAIâ€, sostuvo Salazar La abogada reconoce que este plantÃ³n es una forma de ejercer presiÃ³n para que se haga justicia,pues, afirma, caso contrario en el sistema judicial ecuatoriano lo que va a ocurrir es que se va a sistematizar la impunidad y eso no lo van a permitir. Publicidad Amanda Villavicencio no quiso profundizar sobre las amenazas que les habrÃ­a proferido alias Invisible a ella y a su hermana, mediante el chat de Zoom de la audiencia de juzgamiento que se da en el Complejo Judicial de Quito. Lo que sÃ­ contÃ³ es lo â€œrevictimizante y horribleâ€ que ha sido estar conectada en la audiencia con los â€œbandidos y delincuentesâ€ que asesinaron a su padre. â€œEstamos ahÃ­ nosotras y ellos, y ellos estÃ¡n felices, estÃ¡n gozando, se planchan el pelo, estÃ¡n abrazados, se hacen chistes de una cÃ¡rcel a otra. Y se nota que son amigos. AdemÃ¡s, se nota que son panas y que la estÃ¡n pasando bien. Prenden el micrÃ³fono cuando les da la gana, dicen lo que les da la gana. Y eso, mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de las palabras que digan, demuestra que ellos saben que tienen el sartÃ©n por el mango, que ellos dominan. Les vemos ahÃ­, los del SNAI, asÃ­ malÃ­simos, con sus mÃ¡scaras, con todo. Â¿QuÃ© hacen? Nada, absolutamente nada. Eso ya es como una ofensa, saben, es una ofensa contra la justicia. AdemÃ¡s, es una ofensa contra este corazÃ³n roto, porque no les deseaba a nadie ese dolorâ€, recordÃ³ Amanda. Publicidad [Yo veo un caso dÃ©bil por parte de la FiscalÃ­a, afirma VerÃ³nica Sarauz, viuda de Fernando Villavicencio](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/politica/por-que-no-esta-procesado-el-chino-onda-cuestiona-veronica-sarauz-viuda-de-fernando-villavicencio-nota/) Al ser consultada sobre si se podÃ­a saber quÃ© les dijeron en el chat, la hija mayor de Fernando Villavicencio fue clara al explicar que no lo han hecho porque ven que â€œmedios podridosâ€ tergiversan la informaciÃ³n y mueven eso a su conveniencia. â€œNosotras no queremos ser exhibidas ante las mafias, no queremos que esos mensajes sean reconocidos como victorias de esos grupos delincuenciales. Por eso les pido a todos los periodistas que yo sÃ© que nos cuidan y nos quieren, (...) que no nos expongan por ganarse un like. No nos expongan porque saben, nos duele, nos duele y nos ponen en peligroâ€. (I)

author: Aarav Singh Gill
title: â€˜My Heart Dies Every Timeâ€™ - Naomi Osaka Feels Devastated in Heartbreaking Admission on Reaching Peak Playing Again - EssentiallySports
text: Debate Can Naomi Osaka overcome her emotional struggles to reclaim her spot at the top? No such thing as a dramatic ending to a playerâ€™s post-match presser, right? Well, think again. [Naomi Osaka](https://www.essentiallysports.com/tag/naomi-osaka/) never fails to change that. The Japanese talent has crashed out of the [US Open](https://www.essentiallysports.com/tag/us-open-twenty-twenty-four/), facing an early exit in the eventâ€™s second round. However, her recent string of losses elicited her to term how heartbreaking it is for her to endure such premature exits. Having returned to the Tour after her pregnancy hiatus, the former World No. 1 came high-spirited at the Flushing Meadows event. Despite showcasing remarkable progress lately and with it, thwarting Jelena Ostapenkoâ€˜s challenge in the opener, Osaka failed. She was thrashed by Karolina Muchova, 6-3, 7-6(5), having displayed commendable resilience in the second set. Later, while talking to the reporters in New York, the Japanese star expressed, â€œI feel like my heart dies every time I lose.â€ ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad The four-time Major champion acknowledged that she was a shadow of her former self before stepping onto the sidelines due to her pregnancy. However, Osaka emitted optimism, citing that she â€˜feels betterâ€™ with her performances and aims to address her emotions whenever suffering a thumping loss as such. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad She said, â€œI feel Iâ€™m coming back from pregnancy but also it wasnâ€™t like in 2022 I was the best version of myself. In some way, I had to catch up to that and also Iâ€™m truly to pass it as the same time. Itâ€™s been a little difficult. I feel faster. I feel better. But I lost in the 2nd round so itâ€™s a little rough. Itâ€™s tough because I take these losses personally. This is a dramatic word.. but I feel like my heart dies every time I lose. It sucks a lot. But Iâ€™ve been trying to be more mature and learn and talk more about them.â€ Whatâ€™s your reaction? Naomi Osaka's heartbreaking admission: "My heart dies every time." React! Reactions Naomi Osaka after her loss to Karolina Muchova at the US Open, â€˜I feel like my heart dies every time I loseâ€™ â€œI feel Iâ€™m coming back from pregnancy but also it wasnâ€™t like in 2022 I was the best version of myself. In some way, I had to catch up to that and also Iâ€™m truly to passâ€¦ [pic.twitter.com/tsDpjLUcRg] â€” The Tennis Letter (@TheTennisLetter) [August 30, 2024] ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad

author: @gurufocus
title: Tyler Technologies Reports First Quarter 2025 Results | TYL Stock News
text:
- Tyler Technologies (
TYL,Financial) announced its financial results for Q1 2025. - The company will discuss the earnings in a conference call on April 24, 2025.
- Tyler Technologies is a leading provider of integrated software solutions for the public sector.
Tyler Technologies, Inc. (TYL) released its first-quarter financial results for the period ending March 31, 2025. As a notable player in the software application industry, Tyler Technologies continues to offer innovative integrated software and technology services, primarily targeting government entities at local, state, and federal levels.
The earnings announcement will be further detailed in a conference call scheduled for April 24, 2025, at 10:00 a.m. ET. Interested participants can join the call by dialing 646-307-1963, using the conference name as a reference. Additionally, a live audio webcast and replay of the call will be accessible via the company's investor relations website.
Tyler Technologies, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is recognized for its commitment to enhancing operational efficiency and transparency among government entities. With a successful track record of over 45,000 installations across 13,000 locations, the company has cemented its presence in all 50 states, Canada, the Caribbean, Australia, and further international markets.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance
